intro: Xylobium cuneiforme, commonly known as the narrow-leaf xylobium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Xylobium cuneiforme is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
